summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The meeting is a session of the Senior Affairs Commission (SAC) of the City of Dallas, scheduled for January 13, 2025, at 10:00 A.M. in the L1FN Auditorium at Dallas City Hall. The primary purpose is to engage in a listening session regarding the Senior Services Strategic Plan, allowing for community input on aging services.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Call to Order by Chair Peter Kline.
2. Public Speakers will be allowed to address the Commission regarding the Senior Services Strategic Plan.
3. An update on the Senior Services Strategic Plan will be presented by consultants from Guidehouse, Inc. and CoSpero Consulting, focusing on community needs and priorities for aging services.

**Important Details**:  
The presentation will include insights from consultants Lance Robertson, Richard Hanely, Claudia Sandoval, Jay Wright (Guidehouse, Inc.), and Tony Moten, Jr., Madeline Holler (CoSpero Consulting). The session aims to gather feedback from the Commission on the evolving needs of the community concerning senior services.

**Action Items**:  
The Commission is expected to provide input and feedback on the strategic plan, which may influence future decisions regarding aging services. No formal decisions or approvals are listed on the agenda, but the insights gathered will be crucial for shaping the strategic direction of senior services in Dallas. 

The meeting will also ensure accessibility for all participants, with provisions for auxiliary aids and translation services.
